channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: sports

item.title: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts says Shohei Ohtani a possibility to start Game 7 of World Series
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Shohei Ohtani might start Game 7 of the World Series on Saturday. Tyler Glasnow might pitch on back-to-back days. For Los Angeles Dodgers manager Dave Roberts, the only certainty is that Yoshinobu Yamamoto won't pitch. Besides that? "Everyone will be available," Roberts said.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Jaguars place two-way star Travis Hunter on injured reserve with a right knee injury
item.description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. (AP) — The Jacksonville Jaguars placed two-way star Travis Hunter on injured reserve Friday because of a knee injury. Coach Liam Coen announced the move a day after Hunter injured his right knee in practice.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Auger-Aliassime ends Vacherot's impressive run at the Paris Masters
item.description: PARIS (AP) — Felix Auger-Aliassime ended Valentin Vacherot’s impressive run at the Paris Masters on Friday with a 6-2, 6-2 win in the quarterfinals.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Buccaneers hope to get injured players back soon as tough stretch awaits after bye week
item.description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers overcame several injuries to key players and kept winning in the first half of their season.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Blue Jays 1 win away from ending 32-year World Series championship drought
item.description: The Toronto Blue Jays are one win away from capturing their first World Series title in 32 years and will take on the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 6 of the Fall Classic on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Dolphins rookie furious after being called for questionable penalty vs Ravens
item.description: Miami Dolphins rookie running back Ollie Gordon II exploded on the sideline after he was called for a questionable tripping penalty against the Baltimore Ravens.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Panthers star steps away from team to coach friend's youth hockey team for heartbreaking reason
item.description: Florida Panthers forward Brad Marchand stepped away to coach his friend’s U18 team in Halifax, honoring the memory of his friend’s 10-year-old daughter, Selah.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Foot note in the outfield: Toronto's Davis Schneider skips shoes a day before playing for title
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A day before playing for a World Series title, Davis Schneider went barefoot in the park. Toronto players arrived at Rogers Centre at about 8 a.m. Thursday after a red-eye flight from Los Angeles that followed their 6-1 win over the Dodgers.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Matchup of powerhouse Chicagoland programs highlights 1st round of IHSA state football playoffs this weekend
item.description: In what surely has to be one of the most significant first-round matchups in IHSA state football playoff history, longtime rivals Chicago Mt. Carmel and Loyola Academy of Wilmette square off at 4:30 p.m. Saturday in the Class 8A bracket, which has the state's largest programs.
item.dc:creator: Michael Johnson, WGN 9

item.title: Jazz comeback bid falls short against Blazers, 136-134
item.description: SALT LAKE CITY (ABC4 Sports) - The Utah Jazz almost pulled off a miraculous fourth quarter comeback Wednesday night against Portland, but came up just short in a 136-134 loss at the Delta Center.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Matas Buzelis scores 27 and Bulls move to 4-0 with 126-113 win over Kings
item.description: Matas Buzelis scored 27 points, and the Chicago Bulls defeated the Sacramento Kings 126-113 on Wednesday night to remain unbeaten.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Rare Michael Jordan sneakers from 'Bad Boys' rivalry era scuffle heading to auction
item.description: A rare pair of Michael Jordan game-worn Air Jordan 1s from the night of October 26, 1985, when tensions between the Bulls and the Pistons exploded, will be auctioned off by Gray Flannel Auctions on November 16.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: Jason Kreis named RSL President of Soccer Operations
item.description: SANDY, Utah (ABC4 Sports) - Jason Kreis has a new role with Real Salt Lake. The former RSL player and head coach was named the team's President of Soccer Operations. Kreis returned to Real Salt Lake nearly two years ago as the team's Director of Club Operations and Special Projects.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Music icon Sting to headline Super Bowl concert series in SF
item.description: SAN FRANCISCO (KRON) -- Music icon Sting has been announced as the opening night headliner for a concert series in San Francisco next year set to coincide with the Bay Area's hosting of Super Bowl LX. The 17-time Grammy Award-winning artist is to perform Friday, Feb. 6 at SF's Palace of Fine Arts.
item.dc:creator: Alex Baker, KRON4

item.title: Questionable officiating outshines Bucs win in New Orleans
item.description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers left New Orleans with a dominant 23-3 victory over the Saints, but a pair of questionable calls by NFL officials kept it from being even worse for the home team.
item.dc:creator: Garrett Phillips, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Freeman's homer in 18th inning lifts Dodgers over Blue Jays, 6-5, in World Series classic
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Eighteen innings in Game 3 of the World Series at Dodger Stadium again. And this Hollywood rerun had a similar ending.
item.dc:creator: BETH HARRIS, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Michael Brennan wins Bank of Utah Championship
item.description: IVINS, Utah (ABC4 Sports) - Michael Brennan was just as dominant at Black Desert as he was on the PGA Tour Americas. He closed with a 5-under 66 to go from a sponsor exemption to a PGA Tour winner Sunday with his four-shot victory in the Bank of Utah Championship.
item.dc:creator: Dana Greene, ABC 4

item.title: Lakers' Luka Doncic likely out at least one week with a sprained finger and a bruised leg
item.description: Luka Doncic is expected to be sidelined for at least a week because of a sprained finger on his left hand and a bruised lower left leg, the Los Angeles Lakers announced Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: ESPN's 'College Gameday' set to return to the University of Utah ahead of major Big 12 clash
item.description: ESPN announced the return of "College Gameday," the network's weekly, traveling college football pregame show, to the University of Utah's campus ahead of the Utes' pivotal conference matchup against the Cincinnati Bearcats Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Nick Butts, ABC 4

item.title: Jury: NCAA to pay $18M to former football player, his wife in concussion lawsuit
item.description: The NCAA owes a former college football player and his wife $18 million, a South Carolina jury decided while finding college sports’ major governing body negligent in failing to warn the player about the long-term effects of concussions.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: SDFC to host sellout crowd at Snapdragon for first-ever playoff match: How to watch
item.description: San Diego FC will host the Portland Timbers at Snapdragon Stadium on Sunday for Game 1 of Round 1 of the 2025 MLS Cup Playoffs, with tickets sold out and fans able to watch or listen from home or at local bars and restaurants.
item.dc:creator: Sharisse Cohee, Fox 5

item.title: Former NFL center Nick Mangold dies seeking kidney transplant
item.description: His death comes less than two weeks after the two-time All-Pro selection announced on social media that he had kidney disease and needed a transplant.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Jays' Bo Bichette held out of starting lineup, pinch-hits in World Series Game 2
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Held out of the starting lineup a day after returning from a knee injury, Blue Jays infielder Bo Bichette grounded out as a pinch-hitter in the seventh inning of World Series Game 2 on Saturday night.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Rob Manfred increasingly confident major leaguers will play in 2028 LA Olympics
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — Major League Baseball Commissioner Rob Manfred is increasingly confident big league players will participate in the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics.
item.dc:creator: RONALD BLUM, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Orlando and Chicago square off for conference showdown
item.description: Chicago Bulls (1-0, fourth in the Eastern Conference) vs. Orlando Magic (1-1, eighth in the Eastern Conference) Orlando, Florida; Saturday, 6 p.m. CDT BETMGM SPORTSBOOK LINE: Magic -5.5; over/under is 232.5 BOTTOM LINE: Chicago takes on Orlando for an Eastern Conference matchup.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9
